articles.author: miku iwai
articles.description:
The professional landscape is undergoing a profound transformation. What was once the realm of science fiction is now a daily reality in offices and homes worldwide: artificial intelligence. This isn't merely a technological upgrade; it's a fundamental reordering of how work gets done, how value is created, and how careers are forged. For those who understand and can skillfully interact with AI, this moment presents an unprecedented opportunity ‚Äì not just to adapt, but to thrive.
Gone are the days when AI was solely the domain of specialized researchers in cloistered labs. Today, AI is a versatile toolkit, a co-pilot, and in some cases, the very engine of new ventures. The true value isn't just in building the AI itself, but in knowing how to wield it, how to speak its language, and how to‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Monetize Your AI Skills: A Career and Business Blueprint

articles.author: Orage Mayank
articles.description:
Introduction:


Apple's much-awaited WWDC 2025 Event surprised the world of technology by showcasing groundbreaking innovations and previewing the future of iOS. With developers, technology fans, and Apple fans eagerly waiting around the globe, several major announcements were making the headlines, and most importantly, those of iOS 26.
WWDC 2025 Event Highlights:




Apple Intelligence (AI) gets a boost


macOS Sequoia


watchOS 12 & Health Updates


Vision Pro Global Rollout:




  
  
  iOS 26 Rumors & Speculations




New Home Screen Widgets:


Improved Siri Integration:


More Lock Screen & Privacy Features:


Split-Screen Multitasking on iPhone Pro Models:


Native App Redesigns:




  
  
  Conclusion:


The WWDC 2025 Event laid the groundwork for Apple's upcoming development. While official details about iOS 26 are still unconfirmed, rumors confirm that there will be a big leap towards customization, AI, and performance. Wait for the iOS 26 beta later this summer!
articles.title: Major WWDC 2025 Event Features and Fresh iOS 26 Rumors

articles.author: miku iwai
articles.description:
For years, the promise of artificial intelligence felt abstract, residing in research labs or powering the invisible gears of tech giants. Then came the "prompt" ‚Äì a revelation that let anyone, with a few well-chosen words, conjure text, images, and code. But what if you could move beyond the ephemeral thrill of a single prompt, transforming it into a persistent, self-operating entity? Imagine an AI that doesn't just respond once, but tirelessly performs complex tasks, manages workflows, and even generates revenue, all without constant human intervention.
This isn't about crafting clever queries for a chatbot. This is about elevating prompts from ephemeral interactions to foundational components of robust, automated systems. It‚Äôs the journey from a fleeting thought to a tangible, valuable ‚Ä¶
articles.title: From Prompt to Product: A Guide to Building Automated AI Systems

articles.author: miku iwai
articles.description:
The professional landscape is shifting beneath our feet, sculpted by the relentless tide of artificial intelligence. Amidst this transformation, a new, critical discipline has emerged: prompt engineering. Far from a mere technical trick, it‚Äôs the art and science of communicating effectively with AI models, transforming abstract ideas into concrete, valuable outputs. This nascent field is creating a cohort of highly sought-after professionals, commanding salaries that reflect their unique ability to unlock the latent power within AI. These aren't just folks who know how to type a question; they possess a nuanced blend of technical understanding, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving.
Imagine AI as an incredibly powerful, yet incredibly literal, apprentice. It can perform miracles,‚Ä¶
articles.title: The Prompt Engineering Skills That Command High Salaries

articles.author: miku iwai
articles.description:
In the relentless current of today‚Äôs markets, where consumer preferences shift like sand dunes and competitive landscapes redraw themselves overnight, marketers often find themselves navigating with an incomplete map. The traditional approach‚Äîreacting to what has just happened‚Äîis no longer a viable strategy for staying ahead. What if you could peer around the corner, anticipate the next wave before it crests, and position your brand precisely where opportunity is about to unfold?
This isn't wishful thinking or a mystical ability. It's the tangible power of Artificial Intelligence, specifically its application in predictive trend analysis. For marketers, AI isn't just about automating tasks or personalizing emails; it's about transforming hindsight into foresight, equipping you with an unpa‚Ä¶
articles.title: Using AI for Predictive Trend Analysis in Your Market

articles.author: Web era Solutions
articles.description:
So, you need a new website‚Äîor maybe a complete redesign of the one you‚Äôve got. You‚Äôve probably asked yourself the big question:Fr
"Should I work with a web development agency or hire a freelancer?"
This decision isn‚Äôt just about money. It all comes down to who you can rely on to realize your online vision.Let‚Äôs walk through the pros, cons, and real-world factors that can help you make the best call for your business.
‚úÖ Understanding the Basics
A freelancer is typically a solo web developer or designer. They work independently, often juggling multiple projects.
A web agency is a team‚Äîdesigners, developers, marketers, strategists‚Äîworking together to deliver complete solutions.
Both can deliver results. However, your objectives, timetable, and financial constraints will determine the best opt‚Ä¶
articles.title: Freelancers vs Agencies: Which Web Developer Should You Pick?

articles.author: miku iwai
articles.description:
Marketers today are awash in data. From website analytics and social media engagement to email open rates and conversion funnels, the sheer volume of information can be overwhelming. Yet, despite this abundance, many marketing teams struggle to translate raw numbers into clear, compelling stories that drive strategic decisions. Data alone, no matter how precise, rarely inspires action. What moves the needle is understanding the "why" behind the numbers, the human element, and the clear path forward. This is where artificial intelligence steps in, transforming disjointed data points into cohesive, actionable narratives.
For decades, the journey from data collection to meaningful insight was a labor-intensive trek. Analysts painstakingly aggregated spreadsheets, spotted correlations, and the‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Turn Marketing Data into an Actionable Narrative with AI

articles.author: miku iwai
articles.description:
Imagine knowing not just what your competitors did yesterday, but what they‚Äôre planning for tomorrow. For marketers, competitor analysis has always been essential, a painstaking process of sifting through websites, social feeds, and ad libraries. It‚Äôs vital work, yet often reactive, slow, and overwhelming.
The digital landscape moves too fast for manual analysis to keep up. By the time you‚Äôve compiled a comprehensive report, the market has shifted, and your insights are already outdated. This isn't just about missing opportunities; it's about making strategic decisions based on incomplete or old information.
This is where artificial intelligence steps in, transforming competitor analysis from a chore into a powerful, predictive tool. AI doesn't just gather data; it interprets, connects, an‚Ä¶
articles.title: A Guide to AI-Powered Competitor Analysis for Marketers

articles.author: Chris
articles.description:
Alembic is a powerful tool for handling SQLAlchemy schema migrations. In real-world projects, you often need to manage separate databases for local, staging, and production environments ‚Äî each with their own migration history and configuration.
Local: For development and testing on your machine.
Staging: For testing production-like deployments.
Production: The live environment serving real users.
alembic.ini


Update your alembic.ini file to define multiple environments:
[DEFAULT]
prepend_sys_path = .
version_path_separator = os

[alembic]
script_location = alembic/local
sqlalchemy.url = driver://user:pass@localhost/localdb

[staging]
script_location = alembic/staging
sqlalchemy.url = driver://user:pass@staging-server/stagingdb

[production]
script_location = alembic/production
sqlalchemy.url = driver://user:pass@prod-server/proddb


`
Run the following commands to create migration folders for each environment:
`bash
alembic init alembic/local
alembic -n staging init alembic/staging
alembic -n production init alembic/production

This creates a separate env.py and versions/ directory for each environment.
Autogenerate or write new migration scripts for a specific environment:
`bash
alembic revision --autogenerate -m "add users table"
alembic -n staging revision --autogenerate -m "add users table"
alembic -n production revision --autogenerate -m "add users table"

Apply your changes to the appropriate database:
`bash
alembic upgrade head
alembic -n staging upgrade head
alembic -n production upgrade head

`bash
alembic current
alembic -n staging current
alembic -n production current

üí° Note
env.py loads the correct SQLAlchemy metadata (i.e. your models) to detect changes.


Use the -n flag to isolate environments.
Keep migrations separate to avoid cross-environment issues.
Always test in local and staging before applying to production.
articles.title: Managing Alembic Migrations Across Multiple Environments

I. Scenarios and Constraints


Scenario Requirements:

Convert Chinese audio (including mixed Chinese-English content) to text in real-time or offline on devices like phones/tablets without network connectivity. Suitable for scenarios such as real-time subtitles for hearing-impaired users and offline interactions with voice assistants.  
Constraints:

‚óè Audio Format: Supports PCM format, short speech mode (‚â§60 seconds), and long speech mode (‚â§8 hours).

‚óè Device Limitations: Does not support emulators; requires physical device debugging.

‚óè Offline Capability: Relies on HarmonyOS's local speech recognition engine, currently supporting only Mandarin Chinese.  
‚óã Microphone Permission: Declare ohos.permission.MICROPHONE in module.json5 and dynamically request user authorization:
"requestPerm‚Ä¶
articles.title: Audio-to-Text Implementation with HarmonyOS AI - Core Speech Kit

articles.author: ÂÑøÊ≠åÂÖ´‰∏áÈ¶ñ
articles.description:
I. Technical Background and Scenario Value


Huawei Core Speech Kit provides HarmonyOS developers with offline text-to-speech (TTS) capabilities, supporting Chinese, numeric, and mixed Chinese-English text synthesis. Its core scenarios focus on accessibility services, such as providing screen reading for visually impaired users in offline environments, addressing the pain point that traditional TTS relies on the internet. Key features include:

‚óè Offline operation: No network connection required, ensuring privacy and stability

‚óè Multi-strategy broadcasting: Supports word/number pronunciation, silent insertion, and Chinese character tone customization

‚óè Low-latency response: Meets real-time interaction needs  
Create a TTS engine instance via createEngine and configure language, voice (e.‚Ä¶
articles.title: Technical Analysis and Development Practice of HarmonyOS AI - Core Speech Kit Offline Text-to-Speech Technology

Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that simplifies styling by providing a wide array of utility classes that you can apply directly in your HTML. Instead of crafting custom CSS for each element, you can use classes like text-center, bg-blue-500, and p-4, making the development process faster and more efficient, particularly for prototyping and small projects.
